Current Working Behavior:

Landscape images display in a standard 16:9 carousel below the job description
When a portrait image is encountered, the carousel expands vertically to show the full image
The expanded carousel covers the job description text to accommodate the portrait image's height
Issue to Fix: Portrait images are being cut off at the top and bottom when displayed in the expanded carousel.

Required Fix:

Maintain the current layout for landscape images (16:9 ratio below job description)
For portrait images:
Carousel should expand vertically to show the full image
No part of the portrait image should be cut off
Job description text can be covered by the expanded carousel
Maintain smooth transitions between landscape and portrait images
Key Points:

Use object-fit: contain for portrait images
Ensure the carousel's height adjusts dynamically based on image orientation
Preserve the scroll-snap behavior
Keep the current layout for landscape images
Technical Notes:

The carousel's height should be dynamic, expanding only for portrait images
Portrait images should be fully visible without any cropping
The solution should work with the existing HTML structure
Maintain smooth transitions between different image orientations

because if you are scrolling in light box mode the portrait images and the landscape images will have arrows in very different places And ideally I think in lightbooks mode we want them to be close together so you're not having to move around a lot on the screen to advance or go back images have a think about how that could look
